intro: Ardisia kivuensis, commonly known as Kivu evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. Ardisia kivuensis typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. Its berries are red or orange when ripe and are an important food source for various bird species.
